header.title: Barefoot Sorcery: Introduction to the Stealth Art of P'hansigar III° Sorcery

central_thesis: Barefoot Sorcery is a minimalist, active, and stealth-oriented system designed for advanced initiates (P'hansigar III° moving towards IV°) within the Order of the Voltec. It focuses on cultivating self-reliance, managing energy, and shifting perception and the Assemblage Point without reliance on traditional ceremonial tools or extensive preparations, thereby preparing the practitioner for advanced immersion into the 'Voltec Current' and achieving 'non-human advancement' through a set of '9 Codes of the P'hansigar Warrior'.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces Bare Foot Sorcery (BFS) as a preparatory stage for the IV° within the Order of the Voltec. It emphasizes simplifying magical procedures, abandoning traditional ceremonial magick and props, adopting a highly active approach, and developing the ability to shift one's Assemblage Point decisively without external tools. It's presented as a system for acting anywhere, anytime.

structure_content.chapter_title: Bare Foot Sorcery: Immersion and Principles
structure_content.summary: BFS is defined as complete immersion into one's environment to accomplish specific tasks, primarily through outdoor sorcery (wilderness, city, towns, mountains). The P'hansigar is expected to develop access to and redeployment of personal energy. A core principle is the removal of the human drive for comfort and avoidance of pain, viewing discomfort as a temporary price for 'non-human advancement'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The 9 Codes of the P'hansigar Warrior
structure_content.summary: This section lists the nine fundamental principles that guide the P'hansigar's practice, providing a concise overview of the philosophy and practical directives that constitute Bare Foot Sorcery. These codes are central to the system's operation and progression.

structure_content.chapter_title: The First Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: The First Code states, 'I need nothing to facilitate my Sorcery other than self contained methods of Shifting Perception known as 'Bare Foot Sorcery' and access to a reserve of energy to catalyze these Shifts.' It clarifies that the Voltec stalker must become adept at shifting the Assemblage Point anywhere, anytime, recognizing that such shifts require the redeployment of reserve energy. The code stresses the importance of identifying problems, formulating responses, and executing actions in seconds. It also highlights the critical role of reading people, psychological insight, and attention in Consensual Reality, along with conserving energy by avoiding unnecessary actions and upholding patterns.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Second Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: This code dictates, 'Any props or preparations are a luxury and will be afforded after my Immersion within the Voltec Current.' It instructs the P'hansigar at the III° to set aside traditional rituals, as ceremonial magic becomes a significant part of their Initiation at the IV°. The aim is to prevent rituals from becoming a crutch, instead fostering immediate and calm reactivity. Energy normally spent on ritual magic is to be sealed and redirected for Bare Foot Sorcery, indicating a transition from external dependence to internal self-reliance.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Third Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: The Third Code is, 'My Shadow will act upon the behalf of my Dayside consciousness in times of dire consequence so long as I feed and exercise it.' It explains that the Shadow Self, strengthened by regular use of the Voltec Portal, explores Power Zones and Tunnels of the Voltec Tree of Night, accumulating experiences of new Assemblage Point positions. The Shadow Self can impact realities, stores personal energy, and provides warnings to the Voltec. Feeding the Shadow Self with prana through the Portal is a key practice for its development and operational capability during stressful situations.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fourth Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: This code asserts, 'There is no escape from the pains of Perceptual Freedom and, therefore, I will never opt for consensual comforts over this new found freedom.' It emphasizes that the constant human drive for comfort is detrimental to magical advancement. Discomfort and pain, when legitimately encountered during Perceptual Shifts, must be tolerated and embraced as the necessary price for true magical accomplishments, serving as a 'springboard' into the realms of the Tree of Night rather than being blocked out.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fifth Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: The Fifth Code states, 'I walk as wind and leave no impression where I tread. As a shadow on the wall -as a breeze through the grass, I will not draw attention to myself.' It mandates that the P'hansigar operates covertly among humanity, mastering the ability to blend in and work magic unnoticed. This code rejects ego expansion and external validation, common in some Left Hand Path traditions. It promotes isolation and appreciation of solitude for Sorcerers seeking 'Infinity'. The technique of 'Shadow Merging' is introduced as a practical application for achieving invisibility.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Sixth Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: This code proclaims, 'I will gaze with Infinity as a lens, so that I may read the true nature of all things, of all creatures and of all Energies.' It explains that recalling 'deep Shifts and Movements of the Assemblage Point' (experienced during dreams, ritual, meditation, or stress) enables this 'gazing'. The Shadow Self operates energetically, perceiving inaudible sounds, invisible objects, and utilizing a telekinetic 'hand'. The code describes reading humans by penetrating their energy body and drawing energy, allowing for suggestions and installing the Shadow Self to gather information from dreams. It also extends to taming non-human animals via an 'energetic tendril technique', stressing conscious awareness in all interactions.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Seventh Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: The Seventh Code dictates, 'Silence is my Voice & Darkness is my Vision, for I am nothing until the moment shouts 'ACT!', at which time ferocity is my form.' It advises against unnecessary talk, arguments, and discussions of politics or religion, identifying them as energy drains. Practitioners are taught not to rely on physical sight but to 'see with the Shadows eyes' (clairvoyance). The code promotes strategic speech to shape reality and emphasizes silent observation, careful planning, and patience, ensuring actions are taken only at the opportune moment with maximum ferocity.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eighth Code of the P'hansigar
structure_content.summary: This code focuses on vigilance against 'Internal Dialogue, Patterns and Routines, Self Importance and Inaction', explicitly linking these to core concepts from Carlos Castaneda. It suggests that regular contemplation of these elements significantly reduces 'energetic leaks'. The 'Not-Doing of thinking' is achieved by reciting the Codes to replace ordinary internal dialogue. The 'Battle of Netzach' working is introduced as a specific practical method for the 'Destruction of Self Importance', involving a multi-step process from banishing to energy retrieval.

structure_content.chapter_title: Strategy in the Name of the CODE
structure_content.summary: This concluding section reiterates that the Nine Codes form the foundation of Barefoot Sorcery for the P'hansigar III°, leading to 'Immersion into the Voltec Current' and the 'Work of the Sutekh IV°'. It warns of the treacherous 'Desert of Awareness' for IV° initiates and positions BFS as a 'survival school of the Shadow', necessary for navigating its challenges. It emphasizes that the effectiveness of these codes is tested in 'Consensual Reality' and highlights the dire consequences of failure.

key_concepts.definition: A minimalist, active, and stealth-oriented magical system within the Order of the Voltec, emphasizing self-contained methods, energy management, Shifting Perception, and real-world application without traditional ritualistic props or extensive preparations. It is a preparatory stage for the IV°.
The magical order to which the P'hansigar belongs, structured by degrees (e.g., III°, IV°), and through which practitioners progress in their magical development.
An initiate within the Order of the Voltec who is practicing and mastering the principles of Bare Foot Sorcery as a foundational stage.
An energetic current or influence that initially impacts initiates but subsequently flows through them in higher degrees. 'Immersion' into this current is a key goal.

A stronger, less conscious aspect of the self, developed through the Voltec Portal. It explores specific energetic zones, accumulates experiences with Assemblage Point shifts, impacts realities, stores personal energy, and can provide warnings or act on behalf of the 'Dayside consciousness' in critical situations.

A concept, likely derived from Carlos Castaneda's teachings, referring to the point where an individual's perception is organized. BFS aims to shift or move this point without external ceremonial aids, requiring significant energy redeployment.

The core magical act in BFS, enabling the practitioner to alter their awareness and experience reality from different perspectives, thereby influencing outcomes and accessing various states. This is achieved through self-contained methods.
A state of awareness achieved through BFS, often necessitating the endurance and embrace of discomfort and pain, which leads to deeper magical accomplishments and access to the 'Tree of Night'.
A central objective of the P'hansigar, achieved by transcending typical human drives, particularly the desire for comfort and avoidance of pain, to evolve beyond conventional human limitations.
A conceptual or visualized energetic gateway utilized to strengthen and feed the Shadow Self, primarily by exhaling prana (life-force) into it.

A specific conceptual structure within the Voltec system, analogous to the Tree of Life, but pertaining to darker or hidden energetic domains, comprising 'Power Zones and Tunnels' explored by the Shadow Self.
The ordinary, waking state of awareness, distinct from the deeper, often hidden operations of the Shadow Self.

Refers to the seventh Sephira on the Qabalistic Tree of Life, associated with Victory and the archangel Haniel. In this context, it is identified as the source of 'Self Important emanations' and the 'Victory of the Egeregore of Consensual Reality'.
Refers to the Qlippothic counterpart of Netzach, associated with 'Foolish Pride' and the negative expressions of 'Oreb Zaraq'.
A specific manifestation of Netzach within the Voltec system, linked to the 'Raven of Dispersion', representing the Initiate's success in overcoming 'Self Importance'.
An archangel traditionally associated with Netzach, depicted here as the source and embodiment of 'Self Important emanations' targeted in the 'Battle of Netzach' working.

Entities or forces associated with Netzach on the Voltec Tree of Night, specifically employed in the 'Battle of Netzach' ritual to 'pull Haniel apart' and retrieve the practitioner's energy previously bound in 'Self Importance'.
A Qlippothic energy associated with 'Foolish Pride' and 'Self Importance', specifically referenced in the context of the Typhonian Tree.

A concept, originating from Carlos Castaneda's work, referring to the incessant inner chatter that drains energetic reserves and hinders perceptual shifts. It is an 'enemy' to be overcome through practices like 'Not-Doing of thinking'.

A key obstacle for the P'hansigar, identified as a 'soiled manifestation' of Netzach and a major energetic drain, targeted for complete destruction through specific magical workings like the 'Battle of Netzach'.
A practical technique for achieving invisibility by physically blending into and energetically absorbing darkness from one's surroundings, visualizing its intake and exhalation to become unnoticed.

Referred to as a 'lens' through which the Sorcerer can read the true nature of the Universe, its creatures, and energies. Being 'touched by Infinity' (through Assemblage Point movements) changes the Sorcerer, making universal energies visible.

practical_system.description: The 'Bare Foot Sorcery' (BFS) system is an operative magical paradigm for P'hansigar III° initiates within the Order of the Voltec. Its core purpose is to simplify and internalize magical practice, emphasizing stealth, self-reliance, and direct interaction with reality rather than traditional ceremonial frameworks. BFS focuses on developing the ability to 'Shift Perception' and the 'Assemblage Point' without external props, alongside rigorous energy management. The system is guided by 'The 9 Codes of the P'hansigar Warrior', which direct internal states and external actions towards 'non-human advancement' and effective, covert sorcery in any environment.
tools: No external ceremonial props or extensive preparations are used for Bare Foot Sorcery itself, as it emphasizes 'self-contained methods' and operates in real-world environments. Traditional ritual tools (wand, chalice, dagger) are explicitly set aside during the III° stage, though they are expected to be restored at a more potent level during the IV°.
Voltec Portal (conceptual): Utilized for feeding the Shadow Self by exhaling prana into it, and for passing through during the 'Battle of Netzach' working.

Persian Energy Crystal: Referenced as a potential tool for 'stalking Netzach' in conjunction with the 'Downward Path into Nod (vol.1)', implying a specialized energy-focusing device for specific advanced workings.
rituals: The Battle of Netzach: An advanced working for the 'Destruction of Self Importance'. It involves: 1) Performing a ceremonial banishing (e.g., Inverted Pentagram Ritual). 2) Stalking Dayside Netzach through visualization. 3) Vibrating the name Haniel until it appears. 4) Recalling and projecting 148 instances of one's 'Self Importance' back into Haniel. 5) Crossing Haniel into Netzach on the Voltec Tree of Night. 6) Employing 'Ravens of Dispersion' to disassemble Haniel and retrieve the practitioner's energy. 7) Passing back through the Portal and concentrating on breathing to retrieve spent energy, then destroying notes by fire, with ashes tossed into the wind during a lightning storm.

Shadow Merging: A technique for achieving invisibility by locating the darkest part of a room or outdoors, stepping into the shadow, and ritually breathing it in. The practitioner visualizes darkness filling them upon inhalation and leaking from their pores upon exhalation. This is maintained as long as possible unnoticed, favoring shaded routes for movement.

Energetic Tendril Technique: Used to perceive, influence, and draw energy from living beings. For humans, it involves gazing into their eyes, penetrating their brain and energy body with energetic tendrils from the solar plexus or palm, drawing energy, implanting suggestions, and installing the Shadow Self to gather information from dreams. For non-human animals, it's used for taming and establishing a connection, emphasizing full consciousness and respectful interaction when taking life.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work presents a specific, advanced stage of magical training within a defined esoteric order, the 'Order of the Voltec'. Its relevance lies in offering a detailed methodology for de-ritualized, stealth-based energetic magic, building upon foundational concepts from Carlos Castaneda (e.g., Assemblage Point, Internal Dialogue, Shadow Self). It innovatively integrates these with Qlippothic/Hermetic concepts (Tree of Night, Netzach, Oreb Zaraq) to form a unique Left Hand Path framework aimed at 'non-human advancement' and the manipulation of 'Consensual Reality'. The focus on self-reliance and minimal external aids provides a distinct operative paradigm for practitioners seeking to internalize magical power.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for 'Barefoot Sorcery' is advanced occult practitioners and initiates within the 'Order of the Voltec' or those familiar with similar Left Hand Path and energetic magic traditions. It explicitly requires the practitioner to be a 'P'hansigar III°', implying a foundation of prior magical development and understanding of complex esoteric concepts such as Qabalah (Tree of Life/Qlippoth), Carlos Castaneda's philosophy, and practical energy work. It is not intended for beginners due to its advanced terminology, conceptual density, and the expectation of prior magical proficiency.
